intro: Eleocharis boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian spike-rush, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the Cyperaceae family. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense mats in its native environment. Eleocharis boliviana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and improve water quality.
